Description: Fiscal Shock: A random number representing the unpredictable shock to government spending for the current period.
Social Security Tax Revenue: Total social insurance contributions from firms (tau_SIF) and workers (tau_SIW) on wages.
Labour Income Tax Revenue: Personal income tax (tau_INC) collected from wage earners after social insurance contributions.
Value Added Tax Revenue: Total VAT (tau_VAT) collected from household consumption.
Capital Income Tax Revenue: Personal income tax (tau_INC) collected from dividends paid to firm owners and bank owners.
Corporate Income Tax Revenue: Corporate tax (tau_FIRM) collected from firm profits and bank profits.
Capital Formation Tax Revenue: Tax (tau_CF) collected from household housing investments.
Product Tax Revenue: Tax on products (tau_Y_i) collected from firm sales.
Production Tax Revenue: Tax on production (tau_K_i) collected from firm output.
Export Tax Revenue: Export tax (tau_EXPORT) collected from total export consumption. Variable has trailing underscore to avoid Julia keyword conflict.
Total Social Benefits: Total outlay on social benefits (unemployment benefits + sb_inact for inactive + sb_other for all).
Government Deficit/Surplus: Budget balance calculated as Expenditures - Revenues.
Change in Government Debt: New debt issued (or repaid) based on the deficit (Pi_G). Used to update L_G.
